poem:
Title: "A Prelude to Cuts"

The coin of promise, swift in Hunt's hand,
Spins, shrinks: a 2p sleight-of-state.
Cuts to insurance – a wary band's bait.
Cadence of budgets, draw in the sand.
But what comes after the electoral dance?
Will we enter deeper, this austerity trance?
Echoing cuts, the Chancellor's chant,
Reduction's requiem, no silent grace grant.
